title: The Borrowed Bike
text: Jamal borrowed his sister’s bike to visit a friend across town. The sky was grey, but he thought the clouds would pass. Halfway there, the rain began, pattering first, then heavily. Jamal stopped under a tree and rang his friend to say he would be late. When the rain eased, he continued slowly, avoiding puddles and slick leaves. By the time he arrived, the sun had found its way through the clouds.

questions.stem: Why did Jamal stop under a tree?
choices: He wanted to call his sister.
questions.explanation: He sheltered when the rain became heavy.

questions.stem: How did the weather change by the end of the trip?
questions.explanation: The sun came through the clouds.

title: Seeds on the Windowsill
text: Maya pressed sunflower seeds into soil-filled pots and set them on the warm kitchen windowsill. Each morning, she checked the soil, adding a little water if it felt dry. A week later, pale green shoots pushed through. Maya measured them with a ruler and kept a chart. She was surprised that one plant was taller than the rest, even though all the pots had the same soil and sunlight.

questions.stem: Where did Maya place the pots?
questions.explanation: They were on the kitchen windowsill.

choices: One plant grew taller than the others.
questions.explanation: One plant was taller than the rest.
